title: Does anyone actually use Spellbinder?
body:
In case you don't know what I'm talking about, it's this thing: {{item:3907}} 
I've seriously never seen this get used, ever, not even in a Nexus Blitz game.

I'm just curious, does anyone out there actually use it? If so, who do you use it on and why do you use it?

EDIT: 
So far I'm seeing a lot of Vel'Koz, Vlad, and Diana responses. Makes sense for Vel'Koz since he doesn't need to buy MPen, and for Vlad because he doesn't need to buy mana. Makes a little bit of sense for Diana because she's burst centric and regains mana based on AP so this item would give her a lot of power for cheap.

Spellbinder only gives 130 more AP over void staff, or 120 more than morello. And that's when it's activated at maximum stacks (which is a minimum once every 60 seconds). Against your average target with about 40 MR, void staff gives you an increase of damage of 13%, while morello gives you an increase of 12%. For 130 AP to be more valuable, it would have to increase your damage by over 13%, which it won't likely do even if you have high AP scaling. Furthermore, against targets with lower MR, or those who you've already lowered the MR of with sorc shoes, morello becomes much stronger, a target with 15 MR after reductions takes 15% more damage from morello. Meanwhile, void staff just keeps increasing in effectiveness the more MR a target has, giving you a 25% increase to damage at 100 MR and a 40% increase to damage at 250 MR.

I think the problem with it is that it lacks an identity...

It makes a LOT of sense as a first item rush. When you're on 1 or 2 items, that +80AP bonus from the active makes a HUGE difference in your pool of AP. That's basically a 30-45% upgrade to your AP (and hence damage). It's like temporarily being 1700g ahead of your opponent (two blasting wands) - again a huge amount when you're only at 1 to 1.5 items.

However, you need to stack it - which takes so much time in lane phase since you're not spamming spells and don't have teamfights everywhere for it to count everyone else's spells. And don't kid yourself, you're not spamming spells because you rushed {{item:3907}} and therefore don't have {{item:3802}} and have no mana to spam spells. 

So consider the alternative: build it 3rd or 4th item.
Except that makes no sense - if you want raw AP, {{item:3089}} does SO much more. Likewise {{item:3135}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3157}} etc... all offer a similar amount of power that is always available, rather than requiring a lot of buildup.

+80AP (1700g worth) isn't that big of a deal when you have 10k total gold (17%). Opposed to when you have 3400g (50%). 

So it should be an early game snowball item, but you can't effectively use it at that point.
It's effectively used late game, but the bonus from it matters so much less at that point.

Which is ultimately why you see some Vlads run it (because they don't need mana) and otherwise it doesn't get built.
